src.utils.get_max_timestamp_from_bq

src.utils.get_max_timestamp_from_bq(table_ref: str, entities: Dict[str, str | List[str]] | None = None)[source]

Retrieves the maximum event_timestamp from a BigQuery table with optional filtering.

Parameters:

  • table_ref (str) – The fully qualified BigQuery table reference in the format ‘project_id.dataset_id.table_name’

  • entities (Optional[Dict[str, Union[str, List[str]]]], optional) – Dictionary of column-value pairs for filtering. Values can be either a single string or a list of strings. Example: {‘exchange’: ‘KuCoin’, ‘symbol’: [‘BTC/USDT’, ‘ETH/USDT’]}. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The maximum event_timestamp found in the table. Returns None if

no results are found or if the table is empty.

Return type:

Optional[datetime]

Example

>>> from google.cloud import bigquery
>>> from src.config import BQ_CLIENT, PROJECT_ID, DATASET_ID
>>> from src.utils import get_max_timestamp_from_bq
>>> table_ref = f'{PROJECT_ID}.{DATASET_ID}.ohlcv_daily'
>>> entities = {'exchange': 'KuCoin', 'symbol': ['BTC/USDT', 'ETH/USDT']}
>>> max_timestamp = get_max_timestamp_from_bq(table_ref, entities)
>>> print(max_timestamp)
2024-01-07 00:00:00+00:00
